name: Aaron Steven White
content: Aaron Steven White | I do research in computational linguistics and natural language semantics. I'm Aaron Steven White. I do research in computational semantics at the University of Rochester. This fall I’m giving a talk at Oxford on Characterizing uncertainty in lexically triggered inferences on October 13. I have also released a python package with unified data models and interfaces for syntactic and semantic frame ontologies as well as pre-released FOVEA (Flexible Ontology Visual Event Analyzer), which is a web-based video annotation tool designed for analysts developing custom event ontologies for video data. What I do I’m an Associate Professor in the Department of Linguistics at the University of Rochester, with a secondary appointment in the Department of Computer Science and an affiliation with the Goergen Institute for Data Science. I’m also Director of the Center for Language Sciences (CLS) and the Formal and Computational Semantics Lab (FACTS.lab) at UR. Schedule × How to Find me Where I’ve been Before joining the University of Rochester, I was a postdoctoral fellow at Johns Hopkins University’s Science of Learning Institute, with affiliations in the Department of Cognitive Science and the Center for Language and Speech Processing from 2015 to 2017. I received my PhD in Linguistics from the University of Maryland in 2015. Where I am My office 511A Lattimore Hall University of Rochester 500 Joseph C Wilson Blvd. Rochester, NY 14627 »
